snippet: A joint European and American operation targeted sites that typically operated on the Tor network, which conceals the I.P. addresses of computers.
abstract: American and international authorities announce series of raids and arrests in 16 countries after targeting websites known as the 'dark web,' sites that cannot be found by Google or even by typing in a web address; international effort is largest law enforcement action to date against websites selling contraband through Tor network, which conceals IP addresses of computers being used for illegal online activities.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and DOREEN CARVAJAL
byline.contributor: Benjamin Weiser reported from New York, and Doreen Carvajal from Paris.

lead_paragraph: A joint European and American operation targeted sites that typically operated on the Tor network, which conceals the I.P. addresses of computers.

headline.main: International Raids Target Sites Selling Contraband on the ‘Dark Web’
headline.print_headline: International Raids Target Sites Selling Contraband on the ‘Dark Web’
